Text: RE Plan Lay Review Run Through Cc Dave will be in Tulsa Wednesday and Thursday Is there any way we can have this meeting on Friday Original Message From Geaccone Tracy Sent Monday October PM To Harris Steven Neubauer Dave Hayes Robert Gadd Eric Miller Mary Kay Kilmer III Robert Cc McCarty Danny Armstrong Julie Robertson Audrey Kovalcik Tammy Wadle Susan Keiser John Gilbert Steve Subject Plan Lay Review Run Through Please plan to attend a run through with Danny of your Plan Presentations for the Lay Reviews on Thursday October from in C For Omaha room Thanks Tracy
Mock ups of slides for Lay reviewPer our conversation today Take a look and let me know
Steve Gilbert Vacation Cc I will be taking vacation day today Tuesday pm and all day tomorrow Wednesday I hope everyone has a great Thanksgiving

FW Trailblazer Plan Revenues fyi Original Message From McGowan Mike W Sent Wednesday August PM To Gilbert Steve Cc Cohrs Allen Neubauer Dave Kleb Steve Subject Trailblazer Plan Revenues Attached is a spreadsheet which depicts the Trailblazer revenues for years The million revenue level for compares to the following Year Plan Million nd CE Million includes a million upside booked in st quarter due to an imbalance cashout Year Plan last year million If you have any questions or need additional information please let me know Mike McGowan

FW Beatrice Trailblazer PAF Comparison Gray County Cc Here is the attached spreadsheet showing the variances of the Revised PAF compared to the Original PAF for the Beatrice Trailblazer to C Line C As we discussed it appears likely that there will be savings from other parts of the total project on the TW side that can be used to cover the increased costs I propose we revise this particular PAF number to cover the additional costs and decrease the TW PAF by a like cost The total project economics remain unchanged Rod based on this solution I dont think it needs to be discussed at Stans meeting Monday Jerry I will get with you next week on the Peak Day discussion Original Message From Fiscus John Sent Friday September PM To Gilbert Steve Subject Beatrice Trailblazer PAF Comparison

RE NNGUtilcorp a month Reserve Cc The payment is a nondiscretionary obligation for NNG I am only suggesting we change the timing of the payment In terms of the rd Current Estimate there would be an upside Im not sure why we cant afford it since we have been talking about a much larger base gas purchase transaction Has the cashearnings outlook changed Original Message From Hayslett Rod Sent Monday September AM To Saunders James Gilbert Steve Cc Cobb Jr John Geaccone Tracy Subject RE NNGUtilcorp a month Reserve Biggest problem is I cant afford to pay out the mm Need to avoid unless someone can show me a good cash return on the incremental investment of MM Original Message From Saunders James Sent Friday September PM To Gilbert Steve Hayslett Rod Cc Cobb Jr John Subject RE NNGUtilcorp a month Reserve Rod fy your review Recommendation appears earnings management versus business event driven Original Message From Gilbert Steve Sent Friday September PM To Fancler Dan Jones Dana Cc Neubauer Dave Chandler Bob Cobb Jr John Saunders James Lagerstrom Karen Subject RE NNGUtilcorp a month Reserve I have looked at the Utilicorp reserve spoken with the Marketing account manager and would like to propose the following Facts As of August there is million in the reserve account The contractual obligation to pay UCU million for can be offset by a million credit for value given to UCU by NNG Marketing during the year Thus the amount to be paid to UCU in October would be million The Third Current Estimate now assumes a million payment Reserves are not needed to meet Third Current Estimate UCU has expressed an interest in banking the million credit from to Recommendation Defer million credit to negotiate time value appropriately Pay million in October th quarter Reverse reserve in September rd quarter as it is not longer needed to meet Third Current Estimate Upside from rd Current Estimate is million for the year No further reserve entries are necessary going forward Millions Third CE Proposal Plan Proposal Payment Credit Sub Total Reserve Reversal Net Results million upside to Third Current Estimate for the month of September million downside to Third Current Estimate for the month of October million upside to Third Current Estimate for the year Shift million value from to for a upside in Steve Gilbert Original Message From Fancler Dan Sent Tuesday September PM To Jones Dana Gilbert Steve Cc Chandler Bob Cobb Jr John Saunders James Subject NNGUtilcorp a month Reserve Following up on the income statement meeting concerning the Utilicorp Contract and Reserve provisions Finance would like a better estimate of the liability due Utilicorp under this contract There is currently a liability set up at the end of August Dan
Definitions for Plan Cc Attached are the definitions NNG has been using for the Plan Contracted Uncontracted Identified Stretch Unidentified Stretch Let me know if you need to discuss

Plan Cc The latest from a discussion with Rod Mary Kay and Dave N this morning FAA will carry the depreciation targets may be adjusted for yr to yr increase IMP and FAS will be carried at FAA Potential offsets to yr to yr increases are yet to be determined Thus the above items will not be put into the NNG Commercial Adaytum model

Utilicorp million Cc I just wanted to close the loop on the question of deferring the million UCU credit to The last we talked it was decided that we could not defer the credit because of cash target concerns If this is still the directive we will see a positive variance to Third Current Estimate in October of million Would you confirm that this is still our decision If so we will include the earnings upside in our Quarter Forecast next week Thanks
NNG Commercial Plan Lay Presentation Cc See attached final version of Lay presentation for Plan Call me with any questions

RE Plan Review With Stan Rescheduled Cc Please put Mary Kay Miller and Josie Call on your distribution list for Plan meetings Thank you Original Message From Geaccone Tracy Sent Friday August PM To Cordes Bill Lowry Phil Hotte Steve McCarty Danny Harris Steven Neubauer Dave Hayes Robert Corman Shelley Smith Gary Fossum Drew Hartsoe Joe Hayslett Rod Cc Weitekamp James Concklin Elaine Keiser John Gilbert Steve Barnes Caroline Alder Amelia Brassfield Morris Armstrong Julie Sellers Emily Campos Kathy Stark Cindy Robertson Audrey Winters Ricki Perchal Cheryl Peters Jerry Saunders James Subject Plan Review With Stan Rescheduled The Plan Review with Stan originally scheduled for Wedensday October from has been moved to Friday October from in C Thanks Tracy
S Gilbert availabilityIn case you need to get a hold of me quickly and I am in a meeting please call me on my cell phone If you need to reach me at home my number is

Depreciation Cc Attached is a file showing depreciation for NNG Commercial after excluding depreciation for the capital dollars associated with rate case settlement lines The depreciation is calculated to be million I think philosophically it s a good idea to track capital projects within NNG Commercial based on the life of the contracts used to justify the project I dont think Neubauer is quite there yet My concern is that we have developed an IBIT target for by using a number that does not include depreciation It seems that we ought to offset the starting point by the amount of the depreciation Lets talk further with Rod

NNG RevenuesMargins for and Per your request Attached is the slide we reviewed with Danny today It shows the value of contract terminations for NNG for the contract year of to to be million It also shows that the estimated market value is million I think for planning purposes however we would assume that we would contract for the full value of million either through better pricing analytics new business development projects and or Rate Case reallocation to captive customers The biggest risk would be the South end TFF of million which we would have a hard time replacing at a million level So depending on your assumptions and could be flat to margin of million or if you take into account the TFF deterioration it could be below by to million However this deterioration will be offset by some of the new power plant projects in particular Pleasant Hill which will bring an incremental million in I think you also have to assume that other business development projects will come in to help offset the downsides Sorry if I rambled a bit too much My view is that NNG will have margin targets for planning purposes flat with Call me if you wish to discuss

RE CE and Plan Cc Volumes for NNG CE bcf total for year Bcf day Plan bcf total for year Bcf day Original Message From Geaccone Tracy Sent Sunday November PM To Keiser John Gilbert Steve Moore Jan Cc Hayslett Rod Subject CE and Plan Importance High I need average throughput for the above as soon as possibe Jan I need total not just west Please copy Rod on your reply to me
